\title{Homework 8: Partial Fractions II}


\author{Alexander Gould, Section 3}


\date{September 19, 2014}

\maketitle
29. Give the appropriate PFD:

\[
\frac{2x^{2}+3}{\left(x^{2}-8x+16\right)\left(x^{2}+3x+4\right)}=\frac{2x^{2}+3}{(x+4)(x+4)\left(x^{2}+3x+4\right)}=\boxed{\frac{A}{(x+4)}+\frac{B}{(x+4)^{2}}+\frac{Cx+D}{x^{2}+3x+4}+C}
\]


32.

\[
\int\frac{x+1}{x(x^{2}+4)}dx=\int\left(\frac{A}{x}+\frac{Bx+C}{x^{2}+4}\right)dx\qquad x+1=Ax^{2}+4A+Bx^{2}+Cx\qquad A=\frac{1}{4},B=-\frac{1}{4},C=1
\]


\[
\int\left(\frac{1}{4x}+\frac{-\frac{x}{4}+1}{x^{2}+4}\right)dx=\boxed{\frac{x^{2}-\ln\left|x^{2}+4\right|+4\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{2}}{8}+C}
\]


34. How do you decompose this fraction? It's completley irreducible
already.

\[
\int\frac{2x+1}{x^{2}+4}dx=\int\left(\frac{Ax+B}{x^{2}+4}\right)dx\qquad A=2,B=1
\]


36{*}.

\[
\int\frac{1}{\left(x^{2}+1\right)\left(x^{2}+2\right)}dx=\int\left(\frac{Ax+B}{x^{2}+2}+\frac{Cx+D}{x^{2}+1}\right)dx\qquad\boxed{\tan^{-1}x-\frac{\tan^{-1}\frac{x}{\sqrt{2}}}{\sqrt{2}}+C}
\]


37. Determine if the following statements are true or false:

\textit{To evaluate $\int\frac{4x^{6}}{x^{4}+3x^{2}}dx$, the first
step is to find the PFD of the integral.}

Nope. The numerator has a higher degree than the denominator, so some
means of division is necessary.

\textit{The easiest way to evaluate $\int\frac{6x+1}{3x^{2}+x}dx$
is with a PFD of the integrand.}

Yes. The denominator breaks down very nicely to $x\left(3x+1\right)$,
which lets us break down the fraction.

\textit{The rational function $\frac{1}{x^{2}-13x+42}$ has an irreducible
quadratic denominator.}

Nuh-uh! The denominator breaks down very nicely into $(x-6)(x-7)$.

\textit{The rational function $\frac{1}{x^{2}-13x+43}$ has an irreducible
quadratic denominator.}

Yep! There's no way to account for the irregular constant in the denominator.

39{*}. Find the area of the reigon bounded by $y=\frac{10}{x^{2}-2x-24}$,
the x axis, and the bounds -2 and 2.

\[
\int\frac{10}{x^{2}-2x-24}dx=10\int\left(\frac{A}{x+4}+\frac{B}{x-6}\right)\qquad A=-\frac{1}{10},B=\frac{1}{10}\qquad\int\left(-\frac{1}{x+4}+\frac{1}{x-6}\right)=\ln\left|6-x\right|-\ln\left|x+4\right|+C=f(x)
\]


\[
\left|\left.f(x)\right|_{-2}^{2}\right|=\left|-\ln\left|6\right|\right|=\boxed{\ln6}
\]


50. Use polynomial long division.

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{c|ccccc}
$ $ & $x$ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $\tabularnewline
\hline 
$x^{3}+9$ & $x^{4}$ & $+0x^{3}$ & $+0x^{2}$ & $+0x$ & $+1$\tabularnewline
$ $ & $x^{4}$ & $ $ & $ $ & $+9x$ & $ $\tabularnewline
$ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $-9x$ & $+1$\tabularnewline
$ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $\tabularnewline
\end{tabular}
\par\end{center}

\[
\int\frac{x^{4}+1}{x^{3}+9}dx=\frac{x^{2}}{2}+\frac{-9x+1}{x^{3}+9}
\]


Again, I'm not really sure what can be done here. The fraction is
completley irreducible. 

51.

\begin{center}
\begin{tabular}{c|ccc}
$ $ & $3$ & $ $ & $ $\tabularnewline
\hline 
$x^{2}-3x+2$ & $3x^{2}$ & $+4x$ & $-6$\tabularnewline
$ $ & $3x^{2}$ & $-6x$ & $+6$\tabularnewline
$ $ & $ $ & $10x$ & $-12$\tabularnewline
$ $ & $ $ & $ $ & $ $\tabularnewline
\end{tabular}
\par\end{center}

\[
\int\frac{3x^{2}+4x-6}{x^{2}-3x+2}dx=3x+\int\frac{10x-12}{(x-1)(x-2)}dx\qquad A=8,B=2\qquad3x+\int\left(\frac{8}{x-1}+\frac{2}{x-2}\right)dx=\boxed{3x-\ln\left|1-x\right|+14\ln\left|2-x\right|+C}
\]
